name: elliptically
content:
elliptically adverb
(SHAPE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that has the shape of an oval: The new arena will be elliptically shaped. The planets circle around the sun elliptically and in the same direction as the sun rotates.
More examplesFewer examplesWe now have a sleek modern building with up-to-date facilities and an adaptable, elliptically shaped auditorium.The orbiter will orbit the planet elliptically.The seating is elliptically arranged around the performing space.

elliptically adverb
(LANGUAGE)
If you speak elliptically, you use language that is not direct and is sometimes difficult to understand: They talked elliptically, and they didn't like to share their ideas too quickly. He answered elliptically, "The evidence will show what it shows." See
elliptical
More examplesFewer examplesShe spoke, somewhat elliptically, of the need to engage in a dialogue.The people involved are so numerous and speak so elliptically at times that keeping track of their identities and beliefs is difficult.Those who are suspicious say so elliptically.
